entries.meaning: (India, dated) A hunt of this kind.
examples: A ghoom, too, is often an excellent time for a spear to take on and hunt a pig alone.

verbs.description: ghoom (third-person singular simple present ghooms, present participle ghooming, simple past and past participle ghoomed)

entries.meaning: (India, dated, intransitive) To hunt for animals by stealth in an area where they are likely to be found on the move.
examples: Once more we ghoomed. Turning northward this time, it was the eastern portion of the plateau that we faced, rather rougher country than on the side we had lately traversed,  […]
